definition: lit. “Mr. Lü's Spring and Autumn (Annals)”, compendium of the philosophies of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1], compiled around 239 BC under the patronage of Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Lü
clan name/maiden name
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
surname Chun
autumn/fall/harvest time
surname Qiu

sentences.english: "Lu Spring and Autumn Annals, " said co-, an exercise in harmony.
sentences.chinese: 《呂氏春秋》所說的合，實乃和合。

sentences.english: The second part mainly is to Lu"s Spring and Autumn Annals the cultural viewconnotation limits."
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要是對《呂氏春秋》文化觀內涵的界定。

sentences.english: The authors consider that the book of Lits Spring and Autumn Annals containsrich ideas of leadership psychology.
sentences.chinese: 該文認爲《呂氏春秋》蘊涵着豐富的領導心理思想。

sentences.english: Is this "Lv-Shih Chun-Chiu" really that perfect until not a character can be change?
sentences.chinese: 《呂氏春秋》真的完美到增減一字都不行嗎？

definition: Classic of Rites
Rizhilu or Record of daily study, by early Confucian philosopher Gu Yanwu 顧炎武|顾炎武
Zheng Xuan (127-200), late Han scholar

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
see 八風穴|八风穴[ba1 feng1 xue2]
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
Baopuzi, collection of essays by Ge Hong 葛洪[Ge3 Hong2] on alchemy, immortality, legalism, society etc
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
History of the Liao Dynasty, twenty first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 116 scrolls
start of the year
historical biography
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
